name: Injury Poison
description: Poison delivered through wounds from coated weapons or ammunition
trigger: Taking Piercing or Slashing damage from an object coated with injury poison

application.duration: Remains potent until delivered through wound or washed off

samplePoisons.name: Spider's Sting
samplePoisons.effect: Poisoned condition for 1 hour. If failed by 5+: also Unconscious while Poisoned. Wakes if damaged or shaken awake (action)

immediate: Additional conditions based on specific poison
ongoing: Some injury poisons have lingering effects while Poisoned condition persists

detection.method: Wisdom (Perception) or Intelligence (Investigation) to spot coating on weapon

mitigation: Avoid being hit by poisoned weapons
Wear armor to reduce chance of being struck
Have Resistance or Immunity to Poison damage
Use Protection from Poison spell (Advantage on saves, Resistance to poison damage)
Apply antidote if poisoned (Lesser Restoration, Heal spell)
Wash poison off weapon before it can be used
tacticalConsiderations: Can be applied to melee or ranged weapons
Requires Bonus Action to apply, so plan ahead
Single-use per application (delivered on first hit)
Most effective against targets with low Constitution

srdReference.quote: Injury poison can be applied as a Bonus Action to a weapon, a piece of ammunition, or similar object. The poison remains potent until delivered through a wound or washed off. A creature that takes Piercing or Slashing damage from an object coated with the poison is exposed to its effects.

examples: Assassin coating dagger with Purple Worm Poison before ambush
Ranger applying Serpent Venom to arrows for hunting dangerous prey
Rogue using Spider's Sting on blade to incapacitate guard
Tribal warriors coating spears with natural venom
